Class CsvUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.progetto.csv.CsvUtilities

  • class CsvUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    this class provides some useful methods needed for the parsing process CsvParser

    • Method Detail

      • getLine

        java.lang.String getLine()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns:
        a string representing a generic row of our CSV
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - this covers an I/O error that occurs when reading or writing from the stream (ReadLine)

      • getFirstLine

        java.lang.String[] getFirstLine(java.lang.String cvsSplitBy)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        cvsSplitBy - is used as a separator for a row extracted from the csv.
        Returns:
        an array of String, where each string is the name of one column of the csv file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - this covers an I/O error that occurs when reading or writing from the stream (ReadLine).

      • splitLine

        java.lang.String[] splitLine(java.lang.String line,
                             java.lang.String cvsSplitBy)
        Parameters:
        line - string representing a line to split using a separator.
        cvsSplitBy - is used as a separator for the first param of the method.
        Returns:
        an array of String, where each one represent a word extracted from the line with method split.

      • print

        void print(java.util.Vector<Payment> payments,
           java.util.Vector<Header> metadata)
        for the porpouse of this project this method is never used, but we used it for debug porpouses to print (with foreach) two vectors
        Parameters:
        payments - vector containing the object representation of the dataset (data).
        metadata - vector containing the object representation of the dataset (header).
